title: Best SSD deals today
text:
We've done our homework on the best SSDs around. Let us help you get the best prices for your next upgrade. Shares 
Once you go solid state you can't go back. But there are so many on the market how do you know what the best SSD deal is? That's where we come in. 
When they first appeared on the PC scene the solid state drive was very much a luxury item, and even then capacities of 250GB seemed like extreme extravagance. Now the SSD is almost an expected component of a proper gaming PC. 
And gone are the lowly 30-60GB capacity SSDs too, with even a 120GB drive looking like a miserly amount of space for your Steam library. For less than sixty bucks you can now pick up a 240GB SSD which will outperform even the most expensive drives of just a few years back. 
If you’ve already checked out our guide to the best SSD then you’ll already have an idea what you’re after, but if you want them for the absolute best price then allow us to help… 
- Looking for the best SSD deals in the UK? Come this way... 
Some highlights this week: If you want the perfect blend of performance and storage space then the excellently-priced 500GB Samsung 850 EVO really is where it's at right now. 
If you can make do with a less space and need to save some cash then ADATA's 240GB SP550 is a worthwhile alternative for the more casual user. 
Capacity - 120GB | Controller - Phison | Interface - SATA | $53 - Looking for some SSD speed for your ageing old laptop? Then dropping a 120GB Silicon Power S55 into your machine, instead of the 2.5" spinning disk hard drive, will deliver a great performance boost. Check out this little solid state bargain at Amazon for $53 . 
Capacity - 500GB | Controller - Samsung | Interface - SATA | $178 - But if you are after performance, you wont get better than Samsung's 850 EVO at this price, not on a SATA connection. The speedy 500GB version is still a decent price and you can get it for $178 . There's also a 250GB version for $109, but we recommend the higher capacities. Sadly, don't expect the new 4TB version to be affordable any time soon. 
Capacity - 1TB | Controller - Samsung | Interface - SATA | $490 
- If you're looking for a top of the line SATA SSD, the 850 Pro is the fastest around. You'll be spending a bit more on it, especially on this 1TB version, but the price is lower than normal at the moment. 
Capacity - 480GB | Controller - Phison | Interface - SATA | $130 
- There's a good chunk of money off SanDisk's SSD Plus at the moment. You'll find discounts on all the various capacities right now. You can find the medium sized 480GB version on Amazon for $130 . 
We've picked out our current favorite solid state drives and have put together our best SSD guide which details both the overall best SSD around as well as the best budget SSD as well as the best high-end SSD.
